snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Monday, selections include selling software to companies by persuading its employees to use it, a look at the man who invented emoji, and a...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Monday, selections include selling software to companies by persuading its employees to use it, a look at the man who invented emoji, and a walk-on by a mobile app in HBO’s “Girls.”

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Microsoft Backs Off, and YouTube's TV Dollars
